result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Wayne Neemann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Sample - Completed per Langlade County  Jail.
Sex Offender Registration.
Sexual Assault Evaluation and comply with recommendation.

timeConds.notes:
Commence no later than 6-15-15.
Can be served in any county within the State.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Wayne Neemann in court with attorney John B. Rhode.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 11:01 am.  plea to charge ct 1, ct's 2 & 3 DRI, withheld sentence 5 yrs probation,  Sex assault counseling & assessment deemed by agent & DNA sample & surcharge, costs 60 days jail, 939.617 (2)(b) Mandatory sentence is less than time, Victims rights complied with.  Atty Rhode & def. agree to plea agreement. Plea advisement filed.  Def. advised of charge & penalty.  Ct 1 Poss of Child Pornography, Guilty plea. Def advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. off the record @ 11:08 am. back on the record @ 11:10 am.  Court explains to def. not trying to force def. to make a plea.  If def. @ any time needs more time needs to advise court. Court advised def. of firearm rights & voting rights & DNA sample & surcharge. Def. understands.  Court explains deportation. Atty Rhode is satisfied & factual basis.  Def. has no questions. Court is satisfied plea is freely & voluntarily given & guilty be entered in record. Atty Rhode gives facts was p.h. State gives facts on images.  Court accepts allegation in complaint & p.h. factual basis. Court finds def. Guilty of ct 1.  Atty Laufenberg gives statement.  Atty Rhode gives argument of best interest of community or public on mandatory sentence be less.  Def. makes statement. Court orders  on ct 1 advise def. of firearm & voting rights, DNA Sample & surcharge, Sex offender Reg. & withheld sentence 5 yrs probation Sexual assault evaluation & comply with recommendation, costs, 60 days jail, huber privileges c no later than 6-15-15 , Court finds mandatory & finds lack of record & age does not find public does not have to protected, & remain out of prison & best interest of public not imposed mandatory sentence. Ct's 2 & 3 DRI, Can be served in any county of State, Def. advised of postconviction rights. No Credit.  
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Stipulate identity of Defendant. Arguments by Counsel. Court finds probable cause. Bind over.  Information filed. Bond remains.  Arraignment scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
